  1. # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  2. from django.core.management.base import BaseCommand, CommandError
  3. import sys
  7. class SubcommandsCommand(BaseCommand):
  8. subcommands = {}
  9. command_name = ''
  11. def __init__(self):
  12. super(SubcommandsCommand, self).__init__()
  13. for name, subcommand in self.subcommands.items():
  14. subcommand.command_name = '%s %s' % (self.command_name, name)
  16. def handle(self, *args, **options):
  17. stderr = getattr(self, 'stderr', sys.stderr)
  18. stdout = getattr(self, 'stdout', sys.stdout)
  19. if len(args) > 0:
  20. if args[0] in self.subcommands.keys():
  21. handle_command = self.subcommands.get(args[0])()
  22. handle_command.stdout = stdout
  23. handle_command.stderr = stderr
  24. handle_command.handle(*args[1:], **options)
  25. else:
  26. stderr.write("%r is not a valid subcommand for %r\n" % (args[0], self.command_name))
  27. stderr.write("Available subcommands are:\n")
  28. for subcommand in sorted(self.subcommands.keys()):
  29. stderr.write(" %r\n" % subcommand)
  30. raise CommandError('Invalid subcommand %r for %r' % (args[0], self.command_name))
  31. else:
  32. stderr.write("%r must be called with at least one argument, it's subcommand.\n" % self.command_name)
  33. stderr.write("Available subcommands are:\n")
  34. for subcommand in sorted(self.subcommands.keys()):
  35. stderr.write(" %r\n" % subcommand)
  36. raise CommandError('No subcommand given for %r' % self.command_name)
